poem:
### A Brief Prescription

The green-tinged promise—  
a 4% rise—floats  
like petals on  
a spring breeze. The hope,  
a thin plaster  
on deep crimson wounds,  
waits still  
like patients,  
like breath  
held in sacred corridors  
where healing dreams  
linger in fluorescent  
half-light,  
not quite enough.
